alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 14 at 11:43PM PST until November 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Localized channels of blowing dust expected. * WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park, Chuckwalla Mountains, Southeastern Imperial County and Chiriaco Summit. * WHEN...From 6 PM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds, such as I-10. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Blowing dust may reduce visibilities.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Joshua Tree NP West
